Description: Louis Berger International Inc. admitted to violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and agreed to pay a $17.1 million criminal penalty to resolve charges that it bribed foreign officials in India, Indonesia, Vietnam and Kuwait to secure government construction management contracts.

The Louis Berger Group, Inc. a New Jersey-based engineering consulting company, resolved criminal and civil fraud charges related to its international work on behalf of the United States Agency for International Development and the U.S. Department of Defense.

Bechtel/Parsons Brinkerhoff, Bechtel Infrastructure Corp, PB Americas and 24 section design consultants agreed to pay a total of $447 million in settlement of criminal and civil liablities in the collapse of part of the I-90 tunnel and defects in the wall of the Tip O'Neill tunnel. Bechtel was to pay $357.1 million and Parsons $50 million. The announcement did not indicate how the remaining $40 million payment would be divided among the consultants. Here we assume each paid an equal amount.
